home.adapter_required_message:
Debes conectar un adaptador USB-Ethernet antes de conectarte a la MIB2.

1. Connect the USB-Ethernet adapter to the MIB2 unit USB port
2. Conecta tu dispositivo Android a la misma red (WiFi o adaptador Ethernet)
3. Ve a la pesta√±a "USB" para verificar la conexi√≥n
home.no_connectivity_message:
[TODO: El adaptador USB-Ethernet no tiene una IP v√°lida asignada.

Verifica que:
1. El adaptador est√© conectado correctamente
2. La red est√© configurada (DHCP o IP est√°tica)
3. El adaptador tenga acceso a la red MIB2]

home.instruction_2: 2. Connect your Android device to the same network (WiFi or Ethernet adapter)
home.instruction_3: 3. Verify that the MIB2 unit has Telnet enabled (root/root)

toolbox.warning_text_1: La instalaci√≥n del MIB2 Toolbox modifica archivos del sistema QNX. An error can BRICK the MIB2 unit (valor: miles de d√≥lares).
toolbox.warning_text_2: El parcheo de tsd.mibstd2.system.swap altera la rutina de verificaci√≥n de firmas digitales. Do not interrupt the process once started.
toolbox.warning_text_3: If something fails, the only way to recover the unit is through direct access to eMMC memory (soldering).

¬øContinuar?]

toolbox.backups_auto_created: Backups are automatically created before modifying critical MIB2 system files.
toolbox.step1_desc: Connect the D-Link DUB-E100 adapter to the MIB2 unit's USB port. Connect the Ethernet cable from the adapter to the Android device (via USB-C to Ethernet adapter) or to a WiFi router.
toolbox.step1_warning1: Make sure to use the D-Link DUB-E100 adapter specifically
toolbox.step1_warning2: The ASIX AX88772 chipset is natively recognized by MIB2 firmware
toolbox.step2_desc: The MIB2 unit generally has a pre-assigned static IP address in the 192.168.1.x subnet (frequently 192.168.1.4 for the host). Configure the device with a static IP in the same range (e.g., 192.168.1.10).
toolbox.step3_desc: Verify that you can ping the MIB2 unit before attempting to connect via Telnet.
toolbox.step4_desc: The Telnet service (port 23) may be active but protected or inactive by default. In older firmware versions or specific Technisat ZR (Zentralrechner), this port may be open.
toolbox.step4_warning1: If the Telnet port is closed, it cannot be activated via VCDS coding
toolbox.step4_warning2: In that case, the last resort is direct access to non-volatile storage (eMMC Direct Access) via soldering
toolbox.step5_desc: Once the Telnet session is established, you get access to the QNX command shell (ksh).
toolbox.step6_desc: From here, GUI (HMI) restrictions are irrelevant. You can manually mount the SD card and execute shell scripts directly.
toolbox.step7_desc: Download the MIB2 STD2 Toolbox from the official GitHub repository and copy it to an SD card.
toolbox.step7_warning1: Make sure to download the correct version for MIB2 STD2 (not MIB2 High)
toolbox.step7_warning2: Verify the integrity of the downloaded file
toolbox.step8_desc: This method 'injects' the MIB STD2 Toolbox installer bypassing the SWDL update manager's digital signature validation.
toolbox.step8_warning1: This method bypasses the SWDL update manager's digital firmware validation
toolbox.step8_warning2: We are running the script manually with root privileges
toolbox.step9_desc: Once the Toolbox is installed, run the patching function from the green menu (GEM - Green Engineering Menu) accessible after installation.
toolbox.step9_warning1: This patch modifies the system binary to alter the signature verification routine
toolbox.step9_warning2: Once patched, the system is instructed to query the ExceptionList.txt
toolbox.step10_desc: Verify that the Toolbox was installed correctly and is accessible from the system.
toolbox.step11_desc: Restart the MIB2 unit for the changes to take effect.
toolbox.step11_warning1: After restart, the Toolbox should be accessible from the system menu
toolbox.step11_warning2: The green menu (GEM) will be available for advanced functions
toolbox.emmc_desc: If the Telnet port is closed and cannot be activated via VCDS coding, the last resort is direct access to non-volatile storage.
toolbox.emmc_step1: Physical extraction of the MIB2 unit from the vehicle
toolbox.emmc_step2: Chassis disassembly and soldering of a modified SD reader
toolbox.emmc_step3: Direct access to eMMC chip pins (Embedded Multi-Media Controller)
toolbox.emmc_step4: Modification of the shadow file (passwords) or direct injection of patched files
toolbox.emmc_step5: Re-writing the image to the chip
toolbox.emmc_warning1: This method is potentially destructive and requires advanced micro-soldering skills
toolbox.emmc_warning2: Offers total control over the unit, even allowing revival of 'bricked' units
toolbox.emmc_warning3: NOT recommended for users without electronics experience
toolbox.emmc_warning4: May void warranty and permanently damage the unit
toolbox.emmc_technical_note: By dumping the eMMC memory image to a PC, you can modify the shadow file or directly inject patched files.
toolbox.diag_disk_space_desc: Shows available space in file systems
toolbox.diag_services_desc: Shows listening ports (Telnet, FTP, SSH, etc.)
toolbox.diag_hardware_desc: Shows detailed hardware and process information
toolbox.visit_forums: Visit specialized forums to get the latest Toolbox version.
toolbox.telnet_not_active: Telnet is not active. Enable it from the Toolbox to use this app.
toolbox.ftp_not_active: FTP is not active. Consider it for file transfer.
toolbox.old_version: Old Toolbox version detected. Consider updating.

fec.habilita_integracion_de_apple_carplay_en: [TODO: Habilita integraci√≥n de Apple CarPlay en el sistema de infotainment]

fec.habilita_todas_las_funciones_de_appconne: [TODO: Habilita todas las funciones de App-Connect]
fec.habilita_el_monitor_de_rendimiento_en_el: [TODO: Habilita el monitor de rendimiento en el cuadro digital]
fec.subtitle: [TODO: Feature Enable Codes para activaci√≥n de funciones SWaP]
fec.technical_note: The MIB STD2 Toolbox automates the 'patching' process. Instead of trying to crack VW's private key (computationally infeasible), the Toolbox modifies the system binary to alter the signature verification routine.
fec.vehicle_data_desc: For custom code generation based on VIN/VCRN
fec.vcrn_invalid: Invalid VCRN (must have between 8 and 20 characters)
fec.confirm_injection_message:
[TODO: ¬øInyectar {count} c√≥digo(s) FEC v√≠a Telnet?

La unidad se reiniciar√° autom√°ticamente.]
fec.exception_list_generated_message: [TODO: El archivo ExceptionList.txt ha sido creado exitosamente.]
fec.step1_desc: Use the FEC generator based on VIN and VCRN, or use predefined codes.
fec.step2_desc: Generate the ExceptionList.txt file with the desired FEC codes.
fec.step3_desc: Make sure the MIB2 STD2 Toolbox is installed on the unit.
fec.step4_desc: Run the 'Patch tsd.mibstd2.system.swap' function from the Toolbox green menu (GEM).
fec.step5_desc: Once the system is patched, query the generated ExceptionList.txt. Codes will be accepted as 'Legal' regardless of cryptographic signature.
fec.warning1: This method bypasses VW AG's digital firmware validation
fec.warning2: Only works on 1-SD units that lack the necessary validation routines
fec.warning4: Create backup before applying any modification
fec.android_auto_desc: Enables Android Auto integration in the infotainment system
fec.maps_row_desc: Enables ROW map region (Rest of World)
fec.carplay_desc: Enables Apple CarPlay integration in the infotainment system
fec.perf_monitor_desc: Enables performance monitor in digital cluster
fec.error_invalid_vin: Invalid VIN. Must have 17 alphanumeric characters.
fec.error_invalid_vcrn: Invalid VCRN. Must have between 8 and 20 characters.

[TODO: Este modo intenta restaurar la EEPROM sin validaciones de seguridad.

‚ö†Ô∏è ADVERTENCIAS:
‚Ä¢ Puede da√±ar permanentemente el adaptador
‚Ä¢ No se verificar√° compatibilidad
‚Ä¢ No se crear√° backup previo

Usa esta opci√≥n SOLO si el adaptador no responde a m√©todos normales.

¬øDeseas continuar?]
recovery.instructions_text:
1. Connect the bricked adapter with OTG cable
2. Verify it appears as "Bricked" above
3. Select a compatible backup (same chipset)
4. Tap "Restore" and confirm the operation
5. Disconnect and reconnect the adapter
6. Verify the VID/PID has been restored

If the normal method doesn't work, use "Force" as a last resort.

auto_spoof.title: [TODO: Spoofing Autom√°tico]
auto_spoof.requirements_message:
[TODO: ‚úÖ ANTES DE CONTINUAR, VERIFICA:

1. Cable OTG conectado correctamente
2. Adaptador USB enchufado firmemente
3. Bater√≠a del tel√©fono >20%
4. NO desconectar√°s el adaptador durante el proceso

‚ö†Ô∏è Desconectar durante la escritura puede INUTILIZAR el adaptador permanentemente.

¬øTodos los requisitos est√°n cumplidos?]
auto_spoof.critical_warning_message:
[TODO: Esta operaci√≥n modificar√° permanentemente la EEPROM del adaptador USB.

‚ö†Ô∏è RIESGOS:
‚Ä¢ Puede inutilizar el dispositivo ("bricking")
‚Ä¢ No se puede deshacer f√°cilmente
‚Ä¢ Requiere reconexi√≥n f√≠sica del adaptador

‚úÖ REQUISITOS:
‚Ä¢ Adaptador ASIX AX88772A o AX88772B
‚Ä¢ EEPROM externa (NO eFuse)
‚Ä¢ Alimentaci√≥n estable durante el proceso

¬øDeseas continuar?]
auto_spoof.final_confirmation_message:
[TODO: Esta es la √∫ltima oportunidad de cancelar.

El proceso de spoofing:
1. Leer√° la EEPROM actual
2. Crear√° un backup autom√°tico
3. Escribir√° el nuevo VID/PID
4. Verificar√° los cambios

¬øEst√°s absolutamente seguro?]
auto_spoof.warning_1: [TODO: Solo funciona con adaptadores ASIX AX88772A/B]

settings.title: Settings
settings.language_description: [TODO: Selecciona el idioma de la aplicaci√≥n]
settings.faq_adapter_a: [TODO: Solo los adaptadores con chipset ASIX AX88772A o AX88772B con EEPROM externa son compatibles para spoofing. Los adaptadores Realtek, Broadcom o con eFuse NO son compatibles. El adaptador m√°s recomendado es el D-Link DUB-E100 Rev B1.]
settings.faq_spoofing_a: [TODO: El spoofing modifica el identificador del fabricante (VID) y producto (PID) del adaptador USB para que la unidad MIB2 lo reconozca como un dispositivo autorizado. Esto permite la conexi√≥n Ethernet necesaria para instalar Toolbox y otras modificaciones.]
settings.faq_connection_q: [TODO: ¬øC√≥mo me conecto a la unidad MIB2?]
settings.faq_connection_a: [TODO: 1) Conecta el adaptador USB-Ethernet spoofed al puerto USB de la MIB2. 2) Conecta tu dispositivo Android a la misma red (WiFi o adaptador Ethernet). 3) La MIB2 normalmente usa la IP 192.168.1.4. 4) Usa la app para conectar v√≠a Telnet con credenciales root/root.]
settings.faq_toolbox_a: [TODO: MIB2 Toolbox es un conjunto de herramientas que se instala en la unidad para habilitar funciones ocultas como CarPlay, Android Auto, Vista Sport, personalizaci√≥n del cuadro digital y m√°s. Requiere acceso Telnet y un adaptador USB-Ethernet compatible.]
settings.faq_fec_a: [TODO: Los c√≥digos FEC (Feature Enable Code) son c√≥digos de activaci√≥n que desbloquean funciones premium en la unidad MIB2. Cada c√≥digo activa una funci√≥n espec√≠fica como CarPlay (00060800), Android Auto (00060900) o Monitor de Rendimiento (00060400).]
settings.faq_risk_a: [TODO: El spoofing de EEPROM es permanente y puede da√±ar el adaptador si se interrumpe. Las modificaciones en la MIB2 pueden causar mal funcionamiento o p√©rdida de garant√≠a. Siempre crea backups antes de cualquier modificaci√≥n. Esta app es solo para usuarios avanzados que entienden los riesgos.]
settings.tienes_acceso_a_comandos_que_pueden_dana: You have access to commands that can damage the MIB2 unit. Proceed with extreme caution.
settings.subtitle: Adjust application parameters

settings.security_warning_text: This application allows executing commands with root privileges on the MIB2 unit. Incorrect use may result in permanent system damage. Use this tool at your own risk.

usb.reprogramacion_automatica_de_eeprom_para: Automatic EEPROM reprogramming for compatible ASIX adapters
usb.backup_created_message: EEPROM backup has been created successfully
usb.create_backup_message: A backup of the current EEPROM will be created
usb.disconnect_confirm: Do you want to disconnect the device?
usb.name: Name
usb.tip_3: If not detected, disconnect and reconnect
usb.tip_4: Verify the adapter is ASIX compatible
usb.can_be_modified: This adapter CAN be safely modified via spoofing.
usb.cannot_be_modified: This adapter CANNOT be modified. Spoofing is BLOCKED to prevent bricking.

onboarding.step1_desc: Connect your USB-Ethernet adapter to the Android device using an OTG cable with external power.
onboarding.step1_detail1: Use an OTG cable with external power (5V)
onboarding.step1_detail2: Connect the USB-Ethernet adapter to the OTG cable
onboarding.step1_detail3: Wait for the adapter LED to turn on
onboarding.step1_detail4: The app will automatically detect the device
onboarding.step2_desc: The app will automatically detect the chipset and show if it's compatible for MIB2 spoofing.
onboarding.step2_detail1: Go to 'USB Status' tab to see device information
onboarding.step3_desc: Use Auto Spoof to automatically modify the adapter's VID/PID to MIB2 compatible values.
onboarding.step3_detail3: The app will create an automatic backup before modifying
onboarding.step3_detail4: Wait for the process to finish (30-60 seconds)
onboarding.step3_detail5: DO NOT disconnect the adapter during the process
onboarding.step4_desc: After spoofing, verify that the VID/PID was modified correctly and test the connection with MIB2.
onboarding.step4_detail3: Connect the adapter to the MIB2 USB port
onboarding.step4_detail4: Verify that MIB2 recognizes the adapter
onboarding.step4_detail5: If it fails, restore from backup in the 'Backups' tab

chipset.confirmed_message: {{chipset}} is confirmed compatible for MIB2 spoofing. Tested and working correctly.
chipset.experimental_message: {{chipset}} is experimental. Shares similar ASIX architecture and should work, but not 100% confirmed.
chipset.incompatible_message: {{chipset}} is NOT compatible with Android spoofing. Requires specific tools or does not support VID/PID modification.
chipset.unknown_message: {{chipset}} is unknown. No compatibility information available for MIB2 spoofing.

macros.full_backup_desc: Creates a complete backup of adaptations and configuration
macros.backup_adaptations_desc: Creates a backup of adaptations only
macros.enable_all_features_desc: Enables Green Menu, Video in Motion and camera guidelines
macros.safe_adaptations_desc: Enables only safe adaptations (Green Menu and guidelines)
macros.system_health_check_desc: Checks memory, disk, temperature and processes
macros.firmware_info_desc: Gets detailed firmware and hardware information
macros.cleanup_system_desc: Cleans temporary files and old logs

safety.cap_carbon_cupra_skins: Compatible with Carbon and Cupra skins (Variants 2 and 3)
safety.issue_1sd_no_signature: Some 1-SD units lack signature validation routines
safety.unknown_hardware_message: Part number "{{partNumber}}" is not in the known hardware database.
safety.unknown_hardware_details: Modifications may work, but full compatibility is not guaranteed.
safety.unknown_firmware_message: Firmware version "{{version}}" is not in the database.
safety.unidentified_hardware_message: Cannot validate FEC code compatibility without identifying hardware.
safety.unidentified_firmware_message: Cannot guarantee injection method will work with this firmware.
safety.fec_validation_message: FEC code injection bypasses VW AG digital firmware validation.
safety.fec_technical_details: The patching method modifies the system binary to alter the signature verification routine.
safety.rec_verify_part_number: Verify part number on unit label
safety.rec_check_manual: Check vehicle manual to confirm version
safety.rec_proceed_caution: Proceed with caution when applying modifications
safety.rec_verify_firmware: Verify firmware version in system menu
safety.rec_consider_update: Consider updating to a known version
safety.xds_strong_message: DO NOT configure XDS+ in "Strong" (Stark) mode. This setting causes parasitic brake wear and thermal stress without tangible benefits.
safety.xds_brake_fluid_warning: Brake fluid can reach boiling point (vapor lock)
safety.xds_pads_warning: A set of pads can be destroyed in a single track session
safety.xds_vaq_conflict: In vehicles with VAQ, creates a conflicting control loop
safety.xds_technical: Recommended setting: "Standard". XDS+ should act only as a last resort safety net.
safety.vaq_traction_message: To maximize traction, adjust VAQ to "Increased Traction" instead of modifying XDS+.
safety.vaq_aggressive_lock: Allows more aggressive and faster clutch disc locking
safety.vaq_acoustic_tradeoff: Sacrifices acoustic smoothness for better performance
safety.vaq_mechanical_superior: VAQ is mechanically superior and thermally efficient
safety.vaq_noise_warning: Creaking or tire dragging may be heard in tight low-speed turns
safety.vaq_technical: VAQ (Vorderachsquersperre) is the electrohydraulic limited-slip differential.
safety.vista_sport_message: Vista Sport is only available on 790 B+ hardware units.
safety.vista_verify_hardware: Verify hardware part number before attempting activation
safety.vista_not_available: On 790, 790A or 790B units without "+" suffix, Vista Sport will not be available
safety.vista_consider_upgrade: Consider hardware upgrade if this feature is required
safety.vista_technical: Vista Sport is a hardware feature requiring the specific B+ revision digital cluster.
safety.emmc_access_message: Direct eMMC chip access is an advanced method that can permanently damage the unit.
safety.emmc_brick_risk: Risk of permanently bricking the unit
safety.emmc_expert_only: Only for users with electronics experience
safety.emmc_last_resort: Last resort when other methods fail
safety.emmc_technical: This method involves direct soldering to eMMC chip pins to access non-volatile memory.
safety.conclusion_critical: Critical issues or errors found. Review recommendations before proceeding.

profiles.dub_e100_b1_notes: Alternative version of DUB-E100, also compatible with MIB2.
profiles.tplink_ue300_notes: Common Gigabit adapter. Requires spoofing for MIB2.
profiles.tplink_ue200_notes: TP-Link Fast Ethernet adapter. Requires spoofing.
profiles.tplink_wl_notes: Common ASIX adapter. Ideal for spoofing to D-Link DUB-E100.
profiles.asix_generic_notes: Generic ASIX chipset. Compatible with spoofing.
profiles.asix_generic_a_notes: Generic ASIX chipset (version A). Compatible with spoofing.
profiles.realtek_rtl8153_notes: Common Realtek Gigabit chipset. Requires spoofing.
profiles.microchip_lan9512_notes: Common Microchip chipset in Raspberry Pi. NOT compatible with spoofing.
profiles.microchip_lan7800_notes: Microchip Gigabit USB 3.0 chipset. NOT compatible with spoofing.
profiles.davicom_dm9601_notes: Budget Davicom chipset. NOT compatible with spoofing.
profiles.error_import_failed: Could not import profile: Invalid JSON
profiles.error_verification_failed: Verification failed: written values do not match
profiles.realtek_not_compatible: Realtek chipsets are NOT compatible with spoofing on Android. They require Linux/Windows kernel drivers and specific tools (PG Tool). Consider getting an ASIX adapter.
profiles.microchip_not_compatible: Microchip chipsets do NOT support VID/PID modification. Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets are compatible.
profiles.broadcom_not_compatible: Broadcom chipsets do NOT support VID/PID modification. Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets are compatible.
profiles.davicom_not_compatible: Davicom chipsets do NOT support VID/PID modification. Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets are compatible.
profiles.only_asix_compatible: Only ASIX AX88772/A/B chipsets support EEPROM spoofing for MIB2.
profiles.cannot_delete_only_profile: You cannot delete the only profile
